intro: Nigella arvensis subsp. palaestina, commonly known as Palestinian cowslip, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region, including parts of Israel, Palestine, and Jordan. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its capsule fruits contain numerous small, dark seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields.
